$!You must tell DVLA if you have used illegal drugs or misused prescription drugs in the last 3 years.$!

%You can be fined up to £1,000 if you don’t tell DVLA about a medical condition that affects your driving. If you’re involved in an accident, you may be prosecuted.%

##Car or motorcycle licence##

You must tell DVLA. Fill in form DG1 and send it to DVLA. The address is on the form.

$D
[Download ‘DG1 - Confidential medical information’ (PDF, 195KB)](http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_066646.pdf "Download medical questionnaire"){:rel="external"}
$D

##Bus, coach or lorry licence##

You must tell DVLA. Fill in form DG1V and send it to DVLA. The address is on the form.

$D
[Download ‘DG1V - Confidential medical information’ (PDF, 202KB)](http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_185934.pdf "Download medical questionnaire"){:rel="external"}
$D

*[DVLA]: Driver Vehicle and Licensing Agency
overview: If you have misused drugs within the last 3 years you must tell DVLA - download the correct form to let them know
title: Drug use and driving
